channel.title: CoinDesk: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto News and Price Data

image.title: CoinDesk: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto News and Price Data

item.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block Is Building a Bitcoin Mining System
item.dc:creator: Helene Braun
item.description: The firm also completed the development of its three-nanometer mining chip, which it had been working on since April 2023.

item.title: Some Square Users Can Now Convert Their Dollars to Bitcoin Via Cash App
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn
item.description: Bitcoin Conversions will charge a flat 1% fee to automatically convert a portion of merchant revenues into BTC.
item.media:keywords: square cash app, bitcoin conversions

item.title: Renzo Restaked ETH Suffers a Brief Crash on Uniswap
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole

item.title: Crypto Custody Firm Fireblocks Now Offers DeFi Threat Detection for Institutions
item.dc:creator: Ian Allison
item.description: The products check decentralized applications across 40+ blockchains via WalletConnect, Fireblocks’ browser extension, and MetaMask Institutional.

media:content.media:description: Fireblocks sign at Miami airport during Bitcoin Miami conference in 2022. (Danny Nelson/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin Payments App Strike Launches for European Customers
item.dc:creator: Helene Braun
item.description: Strike, the payments application using the Bitcoin blockchain, has launched in Europe, allowing customers to buy, sell and withdraw bitcoin {{BTC}} in the region, it announced Wednesday.
item.media:keywords: strike, bitcoin payments app, payments, jack mallers

media:content.media:description: Strike CEO Jack Mallers speaking at the Bitcoin 2023 conference in Miami Beach, Florida. (CoinDesk/Frederick Munawa)

item.title: How a Conservative German Bank Offering Crypto Makes Sense
item.dc:creator: Noelle Acheson
item.description: Germany is a relatively conservative financial market, and landesbank are among its most conservative institutions. So what is the country’s largest landesbank doing launching crypto services? Noelle Acheson explains.

media:content.media:description: German bank LBBW and Bitpanda partners to offer crypto custody services. (Bitpanda)

item.title: First Mover Americas: Hedera's HBAR Soars on Exaggerated BackRock Link
item.dc:creator: Lyllah Ledesma, Omkar Godbole
item.description: The latest price moves in bitcoin (BTC) and crypto markets in context for April 24, 2024. First Mover is CoinDesk’s daily newsletter that contextualizes the latest actions in the crypto markets.

item.title: Binance Founder Changpeng Zhao Apologizes Ahead of Sentencing, 161 Others Send Letters of Support
item.dc:creator: Amitoj Singh
item.description: Binance's founder and former chief executive, Changpeng "CZ" Zhao has apologised for his "poor decisions" and accepted "full responsibility" for his actions, in a letter to the judge overseeing his case.
item.media:keywords: Changpeng Zhao, CZ, Binance, DOJ, Letters, Character, Department of Justice, Sentencing

media:content.media:description: CEO of Binance Changpeng Zhao at Consensus Singapore 2018 (CoinDesk)

item.title: Number of Stablecoin Holders Nears 100M Mark, Data Show
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: The number of addresses holding stablecoins has risen 15% this year.

item.title: Nigeria’s Central Bank Deletes Then Reinstates Tweet Calling Crypto-Related Directive Fake
item.dc:creator: Amitoj Singh
item.description: A directive circulating in Nigeria asked regulated financial institutions in Nigeria to identify persons or entities transacting in or operating with Bybit, KuCoin, OKX and Binance, but the nation's central bank denied its real, retracted the denial, and then reissued the denial on X.
item.media:keywords: Nigeria, Binance, Crypto, Central Bank, Directive

item.title: Bitcoin Bulls Pin Hopes on Weaker Dollar to Extend Rally
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: Some banks, however, expect the dollar index to stay firm over the near term.
item.media:keywords: Bitcoin, Dollar Index

item.title: What’s at Stake for Crypto in India as the World’s Largest Democracy Is in the Midst of Its National Election?
item.dc:creator: Amitoj Singh
item.description: India’s general election in 2024 is not expected to immediately affect crypto policy, and its current – restrictive – rules are expected to continue on through the upcoming Parliamentary term.
item.media:keywords: India, Narendra Modi, Crypto, Election, Blockchain, Ledger, Congress, BJP

media:content.media:description: Indian flag, elections, ballot box, casting vote. (Gettyimages/btgbtg)

item.title: Hedera's HBAR Doubles on Misinterpretation of BlackRock Announcement, Then Falls 25%
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Hedera's native HBAR token surged by more than 107% on Tuesday as investors believed that BlackRock was involved in a fund tokenization project on the Hedera blockchain, the token then slumped by more than 25% as BlackRock turned out to have no involvement in the launch.

item.title: In Mexico’s Biggest Election Yet, Crypto Remains on the Sidelines
item.dc:creator: Amitoj Singh
item.description: Mexico is poised to have its biggest election ever in a few weeks, with 100 million voters choosing 628 elected officials, thousands of local officials and the president. And crypto issues will remain on the sidelines during the campaign.
item.media:keywords: Mexico, Elections, Voting, Crypto

item.title: Tether Will Freeze Wallets Evading Venezuelan Sanctions
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Use of Tether has increased in Venezuela after the U.S. reimposed sanctions on oil exports.

item.title: Binance Founder Changpeng Zhao Should Spend 3 Years in Prison, DOJ Says
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: Binance's founder and former chief executive, Changpeng "CZ" Zhao, should spend three years in prison for his role in enabling the crypto exchange to violate federal sanctions and money laundering laws, the U.S. Department of Justice said Tuesday night.

media:content.media:description: Changpeng Zhao speaking virtually at Consensus 2022. (Shutterstock/CoinDesk)

item.title: Indonesian President Joko Widodo Warns of Money Laundering via Crypto and NFTs
item.dc:creator: Shenna Peter
item.description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo warned the Financial Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre (PPATK) to monitor the use of crypto and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) for money laundering during a speech last Wednesday at the 22nd Anniversary of the National Movement for Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing Prevention at the State Palace, Jakarta.

media:content.media:description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo (Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)

item.title: Bitcoin, Ether Coil as Crypto Traders in Limbo After Halving
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Investors are still gauging macroeconomic factors, one observer said.
item.media:keywords: btc, eth, bitcoin price, ether price

item.title: The Ever-Dwindling Chances for a Stablecoin Law
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: Last week, U.S. Senators Cynthia Lummis (R-Wyo.) and Kirsten Gillibrand (D-N.Y.) introduced a joint bill addressing how stablecoins could be regulated in the country. It's the latest effort to try and get something done in the U.S. legislative front – but is it enough?

media:content.media:description: Senators Kirsten Gillibrand (left) and Cynthia Lummis (Suzanne Cordiero/Shutterstock/CoinDesk)

item.title: Institutional Digital Assets: The Future of Finance Is Here
item.dc:creator: Annelise Osborne
item.description: Tokenization initiatives from BlackRock, JP Morgan and others presage a revolution in payments, wealth management and other key activities of Wall Street, says author Annelise Osborne.

item.title: Jailed Binance Exec’s Bail Hearing in Nigeria Postponed Until May 17
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: Detained Binance executive Tigran Gambaryan will remain in prison in Nigeria until at least May 17, following an Abuja court’s ruling to postpone a scheduled bail hearing until after he is tried on money laundering charges.

media:content.media:description: Tigran Gambaryan, Binance's head of crime compliance, is one of two executives detained in Nigeria. (Shutterstock/Consensus)

item.title: Do Kwon, Terraform Labs Should Get $5.3B Fine, SEC Tells Court
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has asked a New York court to impose $5.3 billion in fines on Terraform Labs and co-founder Do Kwon for their role in the $40 billion implosion of the Terra ecosystem in 2022.

media:content.media:description: Terraform Labs co-founder Do Kwon (CoinDesk TV and Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)

item.title: Will Bitcoin’s New BIP Editors Streamline Development?
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn
item.description: Five new editors were added to help speed up the process of approving and merging Bitcoin Improvement Proposals.
item.media:keywords: ava chow, ava chow bitcoin core, bip editors, bitcoin BIP editors

media:content.media:description: (Mike van den Bos/Unsplash, modified by CoinDesk)

item.title: AI Safety for Smart Contracts Is AI Safety for the World
item.dc:creator: Ari Juels, Laurence Moroney
item.media:keywords: ari juels, laurence moroney

item.title: Web3 Artist Shavonne Wong on the Future of NFTs
item.dc:creator: Jeff Wilser
item.description: “Having an eye on the horizon makes things less crazy,” says the Consensus 2024 speaker.

item.title: Mt. Gox's Looming $9B Payout Could Weigh on Bitcoin Prices, K33 Research Warns
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: The defunct crypto exchange will distribute 142,000 BTC and 143,000 BCH to creditors later this year, 10 years after its implosion due to a hack.
item.media:keywords: mt. gox payout, mt. gox, bitcoin, bitcoin price, btc price, mt. gox bitcoin

media:content.media:description: Mt. Gox Creditor Kolin Burges confronts Former Mt. Gox CEO Mark Karpeles (CoinDesk)

item.title: Ether ETFs Are Unlikely to Be Approved in May: Standard Chartered
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: The bank reiterated its year-end bitcoin and ether targets of $150,000 and $8,000, respectively.

media:content.media:description: SEC headquarters in Washington, D.C. (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)

item.title: Crypto Lobbyists Sue SEC Over 'Dealer' Definition
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: A U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission rule expanding the definition of a "dealer" to capture digital assets activity went too far, a lawsuit by the Blockchain Association and Crypto Freedom Alliance of Texas alleged.

item.title: Crypto.com Postpones South Korea Launch After Reports of Money Laundering Probe
item.dc:creator: Sandali Handagama
item.description: The firm maintains the "highest" anti-money laundering standards in the industry, it said in a statement to CoinDesk.

media:content.media:description: Crypto.com has registered as a crypto provider with the central bank in the Netherlands (crypto.com)

item.title: Patched Cosmos Bug Could've Put $150M At Risk, Says Firm That Reported It
item.dc:creator: Sam Kessler
item.description: The reentrancy bug was discovered by Asymmetric Research, a core contributor to the Wormhole interoperability protocol.

media:content.media:description: Artistic rendering of the GitHub page where the Cosmos "reentrancy vulnerability" was described. (GitHub)

item.title: Crypto Trader FalconX Unveils Institution-Friendly Custody, Trading and Credit Services

item.title: Ripple Says $10M Penalty Enough, Rejects SEC’s Ask of $1.95B Fine in Final Judgment
item.dc:creator: Amitoj Singh
item.description: Ripple Labs filed its opposition on Monday against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's (SEC) proposal to ask a New York judge to impose a nearly $2 billion fine against the company behind the XRP Ledger blockchain.
item.media:keywords: Ripple, SEC, Judge, New York, Civil penalty, Final Judgment

media:content.media:description: Ripple ad in Washington's Union Station (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin's Post-Halving Demand to Be 5x Greater Than Supply, Bitfinex Estimates
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: The new BTC supply added to the market could drop to $30 million per day, according to Bitfinex.
item.media:keywords: Bitcoin, Bitfinex

item.title: Venezuela Looks to Tether to Bypass Sanctions: Reuters
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Venezuela's state-run oil company started experimenting with Tether in 2023.
item.media:keywords: Venezuela

item.title: Bitcoin Eyes $67K After Halving as Altcoins Primed for Short Squeeze, Hedge Fund Says
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: Crypto-focused stocks also bounced higher, led by bitcoin miners Riot Platforms and Hut 8.
item.media:keywords: bitcoin, bitcoin price, bitcoin miners, crypto stocks, short squeeze

item.title: Stacks Begins 2-Step Rollout of Major ‘Nakamoto’ Overhaul
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn
item.description: The upgrade seeks to solve congestion issues, and will officially launch in May.
item.media:keywords: muneeb ali, stacks upgrade, stacks nakamoto upgrade

media:content.media:description: Muneeb Ali, co-creator of Stacks and CEO of Trust Machines (CoinDesk TV)

item.title: Two SEC Lawyers Resign Following Debt Box Sanctions Fiasco: Bloomberg
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: Two lawyers for the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) were forced to resign after a federal judge sanctioned the agency last month for committing a “gross abuse of power” while attempting to secure a temporary restraining order against Utah-based crypto company Debt Box, according to a Monday report from Bloomberg.

media:content.media:description: SEC headquarters in Washington, D.C. (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)

item.title: How the Bitcoin Halving Will Drive Action to Layer 2s
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Agrees to Help FTX Investors Go After Celeb Promoters
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: Sam Bankman-Fried has inked a settlement agreement with a group of FTX customers who have agreed to drop their class action lawsuit against him in exchange for his help going after celebrity promoters of the collapsed exchange.

item.title: NYSE Asks Market Participants About 24/7 Trading for Stocks
item.dc:creator: Helene Braun
item.description: The New York Stock Exchange has asked market participants to weigh in on its proposal to operate 24 hours a day, the same schedule that cryptocurrencies operate on, the Financial Times reported.
item.media:keywords: NYSE 24/7 trading, New York stock exchange, U.S. trading

media:content.media:description: The New York Stock Exchange (Tomas Eidsvold/Unsplash)

item.title: Shiba Inu Fetches $12M Investment in a Token Sale to Build Privacy-Focused Blockchain
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: The new network will be built on top of layer-2 network Shibarium and offer enhanced privacy for users.
item.media:keywords: shiba inu, shib, shibarium, shib token, shib price

item.title: Polymarket Odds Say Columbia University President Will Keep Job
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Continuing pro-Palestine protests won't lead to Minouche Shafik having a fate similar to Claudine Gay, who was recently forced to resign as Harvard's president, the prediction market signals. Plus: Kalshi bettors don't think Taylor Swift will break her record.

media:content.media:description: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik, left (Alex Wong/Getty Images)

item.title: Bitcoin Miner Hut 8’s Post-Merger Prospects Look Good: Benchmark
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: The new Hut 8 (HUT), resulting from the merger with US Bitcoin Corporation (USBTC) that closed last November, features a diversified business model with multiple revenue streams, broker Benchmark said in a research report on Monday.

item.title: ZKasino Users Plead for Refunds as $33M of Bridged Ether Sent to Lido
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Cryptocurrency casino ZKasino went live over the weekend but the launch was met with dismay from investors, who are calling foul on the company for sending $33 million worth of user deposits to staking platform Lido.

item.title: Celo Chooses Optimism, Concluding Bake-Off Among Layer 2s
item.dc:creator: Margaux Nijkerk
item.description: CLabs officially proposed using Optimism’s OP Stack for the transition. The proposal will be discussed on a couple of community calls and then go to a vote among holders of the project's CELO tokens, under the chain's governance rules.
